wordpressPost.title: Food Allergy or Food Sensitivity?
wordpressPost.content:
Food Allergy or Food Sensitivity?

 

“The lab results are back and you are allergic to everything you’re eating!” This is what my doctor told me at a follow up visit.

Of course I was confused.  How could I be allergic to everything that I ate?  Wouldn’t I be dead?  She handed me a report sort of like the book reports that we used to turn in, in high school.  You know the ones that have title, introduction, body and a conclusion.  All nicely three hold punched between a clear front and back cover.

I could see the title through the clear cover and it said.  “Food Allergy report for Theresa Skrobanek.”

It was about ten pages long.  My doctor said that my allergies were more like a food sensitivity because I was eating the exact same things each day and/or, I had some other allergies so, I needed to eliminate all the foods in the report and then slowly work them back into my diet to see which ones I was allergic to and, which ones I had a food sensitivity to.

I was beside myself because that seemed like way too much effort and being a person who loves to eat, I was freaked out.  More so because, I’m already a Vegetarian and I was limited as it was to what I ate and now, I had to eliminate the rest of what I ate!!

Turns out that the problem was the frequency of what I ate.  On a typical day for about fifteen plus years, I would wake up, get a handful of almonds and shower.  Then, I would head out the door to work and at lunch I would head to Whole Foods and get tofu and salad.

For dinner, I would eat carbs, etc. and some kind of protein.  But I did this everyday of the week and soon it became a problem.  I didn’t know it but my body was no longer absorbing any nutrients from the food  I was eating. It was now sensitive to what I ate.

We’ve all heard that too much of a good thing is not a good thing and who would have thought that those tasty little almonds would become my enemy all when I thought they were keeping me so healthy.

Some people do get sick from food allergies, etc. but, I just gained weight and lost nutrients.  My bones became brittle, I was anemic, my doctor added one supplement after another marking it up as just getting older until she decided to check me for food allergies.  It was as though I wasn’t eating at all but just getting the calories stored on my body.

There are a lot of food allergies like gluten, dairy, yeast, sugar, wheat, corn, food additives, fermented products and even (dare I say it!) wine.  I love wine..  I won’t make this a longer blog post than it needs to be because if you suspect you have a problem, it’s wise to get a blood test.  It’s quick and simple.  Just don’t get carried away and walk around like I did and act like your allergic to everything a now you can’t eat.

I eliminated the foods on the report and then worked them back into my diet.  Turns out that the change I needed was to not eat the same thing everyday and diversify my diet by, at least rotating food groups, like we all should do.

I do stay away from gluten and I have found out if you have an auto immune problem, like thyroid disorders (like I do), gluten can be like allergy and may attack the thyroid.  I don’t want to take more medicine so it’s very easy to avoid gluten.

Who knows, maybe I created the auto immune problem in the first place by eating the same exact thing everyday?

In the end, I am no longer anemic, my bones are stronger, I have lost ten pounds and I try to never eat the same foods two days in a row.  I haven’t gone back to get retested.  I guess for now, I will listen to my body..
